Installing security cameras: Having private security cameras installed in and around homes and businesses can deter criminal activity and provide evidence of any incidents that occur. This footage can be shared with law enforcement or used to seek restitution.
Self-defense training: Engaging in self-defense classes or taking measures to improve physical fitness can increase the chances of defending oneself against an attack.

Crowd-sourcing crime prevention: Creating an app or online platform that allows residents to share information about safety concerns and report incidents can help raise awareness and support community-based crime prevention efforts.
Implementing a paid patrol service: Hiring private security companies to patrol neighborhoods can provide an alternative to law enforcement presence.
Creating a local justice system: Establishing a community court system with trained mediators and judges can help resolve disputes and address criminal activity within the neighborhood.
